algorithms.name: update active marker
algorithms.html: Whenever the UA determines that a new marker is the active marker for a scroll marker group group it must run the following steps:

steps.html: Set the active state of active marker to true.

If active marker was the last-focused element of the group,

Focus active marker
Set the last-focused element of the group to active marker.
Set the active state of all other scroll marker elements in group to false.

algorithms.name: scrollTargetElement activation
algorithms.html: When a scroll marker with a non-null scroll target is activated by explicit invocation or arrow key focus:

steps.html: Let element be the scroll target of the control.
Let block be "start".
Let inline be "start".
Let container be the nearest common ancestor scroll container of the scroll markers in the scroll marker group associated with this scroll marker.
Scroll the element into view with block, inline, and container.

<dl>
       <dt data-md="">If the activation was triggered by invocation
       </dt><dd data-md="">
        
        
      </dd></dl>
ignored: Follow the hyperlink updating the URL, however retain focus on the marker element.

algorithms.html: The computed value of the continue for a given element or pseudo element is determined as follow:

steps.html: On elements or pseudo elements with layout containment (see [CSS-CONTAIN-1]), if the specified value is auto or fragments then the computed value is overflow.
Otherwise, if the specified value is auto
On a CSS Region other than the last one in a region chain, the computed value is auto
On a page the computed value is paginate
On a fragment box the computed value is fragments
Otherwise, the computed value is overflow
Otherwise, if the specified value is fragments
On a page the computed value is paginate
Otherwise, the computed value is the specified value
In all other cases, the computed value is the specified value

algorithms.html: To be more precise, when a rule’s selector has ::nth-fragment() pseudo-elements attached to parts of the selector other than the subject, the declarations in that rule apply to a fragment (or pseudo-element thereof) when:

steps.html: the declarations are for properties that apply to the ::first-letter pseudo-element,

the declarations would apply to that fragment (or pseudo-element thereof) had those ::nth-fragment() pseudo-elements been removed, with a particular association between each sequence of simple selectors and the element it matched, and

for each removed ::nth-fragment() pseudo-element, the fragment lives within a fragment box of the element associated in that association with the selector that the pseudo-element was attached to, and whose index matches the pseudo-element.
